metadata.title: CVE-2024-35796 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: net:ll_temac: platform_get_resource replaced by wrong function The functionplatform_get_resource was replaced withdevm_platform_ioremap_resource_byname and is called using 0 as name. Thiseventually ends up in platform_get_resource_byname in the call stack, whereit causes a null pointer in strcmp. if (type == resource_type(r) &&!strcmp(r->name, name)) It should have been replaced withdevm_platform_ioremap_resource.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-35796` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
